intro: Blainvillea biaristata, commonly known as the Blainville's sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
